fields.title: [Toyama, Toyama City] Armor, horseback riding, and castle! Transform into a full-fledged samurai, from children to adults!
fields.price_included: Experience fee, armor rental fee, insurance fee, one premium castle seal, one instant camera photo service, consumption tax
fields.description:
At the Toyama City Tourist Information Center located within Toyama Castle Ruins Park, you can try on authentic armor, including helmets and battle coats, and even try horseback riding. Why not try on a samurai feel and make it a memorable memory of your trip to Toyama?
This is a unique experience that is sure to become a memorable one of your trips.

Armor x Horseback Riding x Toyama Castle "Horseback Warrior Experience"
You can wear authentic armor, ride a horse through the castle ruins park, and take a commemorative photo with the castle in the background.
The horse riding experience is led by a staff member, so even beginners can ride with confidence.

fields.title: 【Tokyo】 Samurai x Ninja Premium Seminar, 60 Min
fields.price_included: Experience fee, uniform & wooden sword rental fee
fields.description:
You will learn our dojo etiquette, how to walk and stand properly using a bokken (wooden sword).
At the end of the session, you'll throw boshuriken. (our clan's stick-type shuriken)

Program
1. Opening ceremony & wearing a samurai attire : 10min
2. Explanation of tools and weapons: 10min
3. How to appreciate and handle a sword: 15min
4. Long sword techniques: 15 min
5. Q & A (If time allows, shuriken throwing can be introduced)
6. Photo session: 5min

Demonstration by instructor
In a short opening ceremony, we invite you to have quiet time and enjoy the demonstration by our instructor.

Samurai of Ninja 　attire
The attire consists of a dogi (upper wear) and a hakama.

Samurai sword techniques
Learn etiquette of samurai and handle a sword. （Stance, Breathing, Soft Focus)

fields.map_id: Musashi Niinja Clan Honjin Dojo, 3F, 3-1-13 Matsugaya, Taito-ku, Tokyo

fields.title: Meiji University Museum "The Famous Swordsman--November 4, 2025"
fields.description:
This special exhibition is organized by Baichodo and the Shohei Sword Forging Dojo, with the Meiji University Museum as a co-host. It is held in a corner of the Meiji University Museum and admission is free.

The exhibition will feature precious swords from the Baichodo Collection, spanning from the Middle Ages to the present day, as well as works by swordsmith Kawasaki Shohei (alumni of our school) and head of the Shohei Sword Forging Dojo. By introducing the sword-making process, the exhibition aims to enable people of all ages to be captivated by the sheer beauty of Japanese swords and to enjoy the historical background and culture surrounding them.
fields.address: Japan, 〒101-8301 Tokyo, Chiyoda City, Kanda Surugadai, 1 Chome−1, 明治大学 駿河台キャンパス アカデミーコモン地階

fields.title: [Kyoto Higashiyama Kiyomizu] Perfect for school trips! Archery experience, quarter-bow, half-bow dojo.
fields.price_included: Experience fee, bow and arrow fee (Kyudo uniform for Kyudo uniform dressing course), consumption tax
fields.description: Higashiyama Archery Training Hall is an indoor dojo where you can experience traditional Japanese martial arts, including archery, samurai, and ninja. Using a quarter bow, about two-thirds the size of the large bow used in Kyudo, this is an archery technique based on the principle that "the target is the enemy," and focuses solely on accuracy. Our dojo's archery experience is open to everyone, from children to the elderly, regardless of age or nationality. It's also recommended for school trips, and enjoyed by many students. Please feel free to stop by if you're visiting Higashiyama, Kyoto. #MartialArts #MartialArts #Kendo #Kyudo #HalfBow #FourHalfBow #Bow
fields.summary_1: If you want to hit the target, we recommend this course.
fields.plan_3: Kyudo dressing and one-hour unlimited shooting course
fields.summary_3: This course includes the rental fee for Kyudo uniform.

fields.title: [By Osaka Castle] Learning Zen of Japanese Beauty Calligraphy in kimono
fields.price_included: Experience fee, photography fee, material cost, equipment rental fee (hakama, sandals),free drink served to hotel guests upon arrival (from welcome drink),insurance fee, consumption tax
fields.description: 【Preparation】Calligraphy is an aesthetic expression of Japanese culture. Before experiencing calligraphy, we will ask you to change into Japane【Explanation】First of all, we will explain about the mental attitude and tools.You will better understand the differences between foreign Caligraphy and Japanese "Shodo".The instructor will explain how to hold the brush and how to use the tools.Please choose your favorite Japanese Kanji character to try in this experience. 【Practice】Calligraphy has a sense of quietness and beauty. Essentially, it is important to have basic manners, such as sitting upright, keeping your back straight, and holding your brush upright. There are basic techniques such as "tome," "hane," and "harai," which should be practiced.Learn the stroke order of the chosen kanji.Learn by observing the teacher's demonstration with a model.Practice the kanji you have just selected with an awareness of the technique.【Special】Teachers have applied kanji to the foreign names of our clients and come up with Japanese-style names written in kanji.【Seisho】Participants will be asked to write their chosen kanji characters on a fan and a piece of calligraphy paper, keeping in mind what they have learned so far.
fields.summary_1: Children under 10 years old are charged at the child rate.
fields.summary_3: The "wagami" hairstyle is a more elegant alternative The updo gives a sense of cleanliness and good

fields.title: [Kyoto] Japan's most traditional Kyoto performing art. Enjoy a special performance of Noh with full English translation!
fields.description:
This is a Noh performance event held at Kyoto's Noh Theater. Why not create a memorable memory of your trip with a Noh experience that may change your perspective? This special performance will be fully translated into English for foreign visitors to Japan. Noh is a form of "comprehensive art" that combines visual, musical, and literary elements, and its artistry can be appreciated in a variety of ways. On stage, performers wear elegant Noh masks and costumes, and perform chants and dances to music. Noh's simple yet sophisticated stage expression continues to inspire many artists today.

Enjoy visual and musical arts!
Noh is a "comprehensive art" that combines visual, musical, and literary expression, so there are many ways to enjoy it. On stage, the characters wear elaborate Noh masks and costumes, and sing and dance to the music. Its simple yet sophisticated stage direction continues to influence many artists to this day.
fields.address: 44 Okazaki Enshojicho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, 606-8344
fields.map_id: 44 Okazaki Enshojicho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, 606-8344

fields.title: [Tokyo / Nerima] Trial cutting using "Seriously"! "General trial cutting course" Anyone can experience!
fields.description:
This is a plan for you to experience trial cutting using a Japanese Sword with a general length. You can learn the basics of trial-cutting basics. It will be about 90 minutes experience.

Test cutting with a real sword!
This is an experience where you can actually cut a mat using a Japanese sword (real sword). You will be taught how to swing the sword, so anyone can participate, regardless of gender, whether they are a beginner or have no martial arts experience. *Participants must be junior high school students or older.

Gradually improve from the basics
You will learn how to handle a sword by actually cutting through a mat using a real sword. There are many variations of cutting techniques, such as kesagiri (open cut), reverse kesagiri (reverse cut), horizontal cut, unsheathing cut, and one-handed cut, but you will start with kesagiri and gradually practice more advanced techniques.

fields.title: Special Exhibition for 2025: "Japanese Swords Are Beautiful"
fields.fee_details: 700 yen  for university students, Free for high school students and younger
fields.description:
■Special exhibition overview

Even today in Japan, the custom of using protective swords at important life events such as birth, marriage, and funerals remains.

In addition, Japanese expressions derived from swords, such as "seppattumaru" (to endure) and "shinogi wo kezuru" (to cut through the sword), are used daily, and anime and games featuring swords are also popular.

As such, Japanese swords are deeply rooted in our lives and sensibilities, but in order to appreciate them and appreciate their beauty, certain knowledge and perspectives are required.

This exhibition will provide easy-to-understand explanations of basic knowledge to aid in appreciation, and then you will be able to view a variety of famous swords, including national treasures and important cultural properties.

Japanese swords are works of art made of iron that have been treasured since ancient times. Please enjoy the ultimate functional beauty that Japan is proud of around the world.

fields.title: [Tokyo] A comprehensive samurai experience of swordsmanship and archery in a real dojo---My class is not a tourist trap
fields.price_included: Experience fee, rental fee for practice clothes and replica sword, certificate of approval, consumption tax
fields.description: Once your reservation is confirmed, you will receive an email. Please be sure to confirm. This experience can accommodate up to 15 participants. During this experience, you will receive a lecture on Japanese swords, learn kata (cutting techniques), practice sparring, test-fire a bow and arrow, and try slashing with a mock sword. During the test-slash, you will slash multiple targets while moving with the mock sword. Slashing while moving is extremely difficult. Please experience the difficulty for yourself! Your instructor will be Yoshioki Sumida, assistant instructor of the All Japan Toyama-ryu Iaido Federation. With over 27 years of experience, he has taught at overseas branches in the United States, Europe, and Hong Kong. He is one of the very few instructors in the world who has deeply mastered and continues to pass on both kenjutsu and yabusame. Iai will teach you how to handle the sword, gekken will teach you distance from your opponent and attack/defense, and drawing the sword will teach you how to hold the blade. ~Schedule: Time may vary depending on the number of participants~ ① Demonstration (3 minutes) ② Lecture on swords (20 minutes) ③ Changing into training clothes (10 minutes) ④ Iai lesson (20 minutes) ⑤ Kendo lesson (20 minutes) ⑥ Archery lesson (20 minutes) ⑦ Sword test (20 minutes) ⑧ Certificate of Inka (5 minutes) ⑨ Changing into casual clothes (10 minutes)

fields.title: [Hyogo, Itami City] One-day Shushin-ryu Iaijutsu training! Direct instruction from the world's best Iaijutsu practitioner, Isao Machii!
fields.price_included: Equipment rental fee, insurance fee, consumption tax
fields.description:
This is a training experience that condenses the essence of Shushin-ryu Iaijutsu martial arts, supervised by Iaijutsu master Machii Isao, who holds six Guinness World Records and is attracting attention around the world. You can learn the essence of Iaijutsu that is not just a "form" but leads to real combat, along with explanations of the structural theory of the sword and center of gravity manipulation. Instructions will be given by Machii himself or his disciples, so even beginners can experience it safely and carefully. Recommended for those who are interested in Iaijutsu and swordsmanship, and those who want to experience the essence of martial arts. Even if you only have a short time to experience the "real thing," your view of martial arts will change completely. It is a precious moment to experience the technique, theory, spirit, and soul of the samurai. Please step into the world of Machii Isao's martial arts and experience it with your eyes and body.

Holds six Guinness World Records! A samurai experience with a genuine orientation supervised by modern samurai Isao Machii. Get the legendary technique in your hands now. Modern samurai Isao Machii holds six Guinness World Records and has appeared in many media both in Japan and abroad. Here is a real samurai experience program supervised based on his overwhelming technique. The instruction is safe and careful by a master of Shushin-ryu Iaijutsu Heiho, whose head is Isao Machii, so even beginners can participate with confidence. This experience focuses on the structure of the sword and its original use, and is the only one in the world where you can learn real samurai techniques. By holding a real Japanese sword in your hands, you can feel the history and weight of the sword and learn how the samurai of old lived and fought. After wearing a kimono, learning the samurai etiquette, and mastering the basic sword techniques of the Japanese sword, you will practice Iai and swordsmanship. This experience, which allows you to learn the spirit of Bushido and traditional Japanese culture in depth, will bring you one step closer to becoming a real samurai.
fields.address: 3rd Floor, G-Tech Itami Factory, 3-36-3 Kitazono, Itami City, Hyogo Prefecture, 664-0008
fields.map_id: 3rd Floor, G-Tech Itami Factory, 3-36-3 Kitazono, Itami City, Hyogo Prefecture, 664-0008

fields.title: [Kyoto Prefecture/Kyoto City] Kyoto sweets representing Kyoto! Experience making raw Yatsuhashi from dough
fields.provider: 八つ橋庵とししゅうやかた
fields.description:
"Nama Yatsuhashi" is a Kyoto confectionery that represents Kyoto. Try making three types of nama Yatsuhashi: bean paste, matcha, and roasted chestnut, starting from making the dough. Take the finished product as a souvenir. [About supported languages] Reception and experience instruction at our facility are only available in Japanese. Please note that you will be given a textbook in the relevant language and instruction will be provided using a translation app and gestures.

Making raw Yatsuhashi dough
Mix the flour with rice flour, sugar, and water and pour it into a steamer with steam. Be sure to leave the lid on until it is steamed.

Making raw Yatsuhashi
Knead the steamed dough thoroughly, add soybean flour, and roll it out. Then, adjust the shape, wrap the sweet bean paste, and it's done.

Creating creative Yatsuhashi bridges
For the second and third pieces, you are free to shape them as you like. Please try your hand at making a cute original Yatsuhashi!
fields.address: 36 Nishi-Itemachi, Nishikyogoku, Ukyo-ku, Kyoto Kyoto Prefecture
fields.map_id: 36 Nishi-Itemachi, Nishikyogoku, Ukyo-ku, Kyoto Kyoto Prefecture

fields.title: [Asakusa] [Private] [2-9 people] Samurai show! Powerful skills and acting by active actors!
fields.description:
``Samurai Drama'', a sword fight show performed by actors who are active in movies and on stage, in an old folk house in Asakusa, Tokyo. We will deliver "Samurai Drama - The original story of the two-wielding swordsman MUSASHI" in a space that makes you feel like you have traveled back in time to Japan from a long time ago. You can watch a samurai drama show up close that looks like a movie. You can experience this power and realism only here!

The atmosphere of the old folk house is outstanding!
An old folk house that makes you feel like you've stepped into an Akira Kurosawa movie. Once you pass through the entrance with a Tsukubai and go through the noren curtain, you will find yourself in another world! Samurai will welcome you. A sense of realism as you watch the battle between men up close on 8 tatami mats. This is a sense of urgency that can only be experienced here!

A professional actor who is currently active is right in front of you!
The performers are active actors who are active in movies and on stage. Among them are actors who are appearing in Takeshi Kitano's film ``Neck'', which is an official selection at the 2023 Cannes Film Festival. Also, the host, Takeaki Abe, was nominated for the Best Supporting Actor Award at the 12th London International Film Festival! ``HALF SAMURAI'', which I performed in and choreographed sword fights for, has won Best Action Awards at film festivals around the world (more than 30)! We bring you the power of professional actors who have trained their minds, skills, and bodies!

fields.title: [Kyoto Nishijin] Tour a 140-year-old townhouse, try on a kimono and experience the tea ceremony
fields.provider: 西陣くらしの美術館　冨田屋
fields.description:
This plan involves visiting a traditional Japanese townhouse, a "machiya," and participating in a tea ceremony in Kyoto wearing traditional attire. First, upon arrival, you will be quickly dressed in a kimono made from genuine silk. You will then be guided around the townhouse, built in the Meiji period. Enjoy tea while listening to an explanation about the tea ceremony in the tea room. Everyone can enjoy tea in either a tatami or hall, where you can sit in chairs. Feel free to take photos during your stay and fully experience Japanese culture.

Kimono made from real silk
Wear a kimono and experience the tea ceremony.

An authentic tea ceremony experience
Depending on the number of participants on the day, you may be seated in a group (shared seating) with other guests. The tea ceremony experience (type of seating and location) will be decided by the hotel, taking into consideration the number of applicants on the day and the availability of the venue. We cannot accommodate customer requests, so we ask for your understanding.

Tour of a historic townhouse
You can see precious furnishings that have been passed down for generations.

fields.title: [Kyobashi, Osaka] Japanese sword, swordsmanship, and match experience "Armored warrior/warrior course"
fields.price_included: Experience fee, rolled straw (2 pieces) price, rental fee (kimono, hakama, wooden sword, serious, etc.), consumption tax
fields.description: This is an experience plan where you can touch a Japanese sword in a real martial arts dojo and learn martial arts. You can participate with peace of mind as you will be safely and carefully instructed by a qualified practitioner of the Yushin-ryu sword technique of the Koryu Iaido Dojo. The "Armored Warrior/Warrior" course will be an experience in which you will wear the martial arts uniform provided by our facility. (For women, we also have feminine kimonos like the one in the photo♪) You will wear our "armor". We also have a "tachi" sword for the armor, which will make your photos and videos look even better! If you wish, you can practice swinging and test cutting while wearing the "armor". You will experience the "swordsmanship", "iaido", "standing and maneuvering" and "test cutting" of the Yushin-ryu sword technique. Please enjoy the real SAMURAI that you can never experience anywhere else! <Experience on the day of the plan> ・Greetings (brief self-introduction), instruction on points to note during the experience, etc. ・Samurai altar greeting ・Bending and stretching exercises ・Instruction on proper manners ⇨ Watch the head of the family demonstrate his kata ⇨ Watch a high-ranking swordsman perform straw cutting ・Experience wearing armor ・Match experience with a high-ranking swordman *The match experience is a 3-minute mock battle while wearing armor ・Experience caring for a real sword ・Finally, a trip to the sword shop to view the swords Total time: approximately 60-80 minutes

fields.title: [Kagawa Samurai Experience Dojo] Approximately 150 minutes of authentic samurai experience with a replica sword.
fields.price_included: Experience fee, consumption tax (registered businesses only), rental items for the experience, facility usage fee, lecture, video learning (history of samurai and swords, manufacturing method / 10 min), hakama dressing, Zen experience (10 min), sword-cutting experience using a replica sword, demonstration of real sword-cutting by the instructor, certificate of completion, photo time
fields.description:
[The Way of the Blade] Authentic Samurai Experience Program: Experience the true spirit of a true samurai through this authentic Japanese sword experience program. More than just an activity, this program offers a deep insight into the refined spirit and way of life pursued by ancient samurai through Zen, swordsmanship, and sword-cutting exercises. 

[Experience Overview] Item Details: Hakama dressing, Zen experience, sword-cutting exercise with a replica sword, and a demonstration of real sword-cutting exercises by an instructor. Learn the true essence of the samurai's spirituality and the sword. Experienced instructors, including a dojo master who won the national Batto-do championship and received the Minister of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology Award, will provide careful instruction. Recommended for: Anyone interested in Japanese culture and Bushido (ages 12 and up). Ideal for those who wish to learn more about spirituality and historical background. [Experience Schedule and Reassurance Points] Hakama Dressing: Dress in traditional Japanese hakama and experience the samurai attire.

Zen Experience: Calm your mind and take time to reflect on yourself, away from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Imitation sword cutting experience: Using an imitation sword, you will actually cut into a target while learning the correct posture and how to handle the sword. You will be able to experience the weight and feel of the sword while taking safety into consideration. Real sword cutting demonstration: You will get to watch the instructor demonstrate impressive sword techniques up close. Reassuring points: The instructors who will be teaching you are black belts in martial arts and will provide thorough support from the basics onwards. In addition, the main cutting experience will use a highly safe imitation sword. Participants who complete the program will receive a certificate as proof of their experience.

fields.title: [Kawanishi City, Hyogo] A part of Tada Shrine, the birthplace of the Genji clan, is fully reserved for you! An authentic samurai martial arts training by  Isao Machii
fields.price_included: Experience fee, equipment rental fee, insurance fee, consumption tax
fields.description:
The swordsmanship that astonished the world is here at its finest. The ultimate samurai experience, supervised by "the world's best iaido master" Machii Isao. A man who has been talked about on TV, in movies, and in overseas media, and who can even cut 6mm BB bullets flying at high speed - Machii Isao. We will deliver a real samurai experience supervised based on his overwhelming skills. The instruction will be carefully given by a rank holder of Shushin-ryu iaidojutsu heiho, of which Machii Isao is the head. In the grounds of Tada Shrine, where history and sanctity live, you can learn the mannerisms, spirit, and tactics of ancient samurai, and gain deep and authentic knowledge, including the structure and handling of Japanese swords. After wearing training clothes and mastering the basics of iaido, you will be specially allowed to stroll around part of the grounds while wearing your sword. In a space surrounded by silence and history, you will have a moment to meet yourself as a samurai. *Based on the guidance of the Agency for Cultural Affairs and the National Police Agency, this experience does not include "test cutting" for anyone other than disciples.

An authentic samurai experience: A living legend in the modern age - Supervised by Isao Machii
Holds six Guinness World Records! A samurai experience with a genuine orientation supervised by modern samurai Isao Machii. Get the legendary technique in your hands now. Modern samurai Isao Machii holds six Guinness World Records and has appeared in many media both in Japan and abroad. Here is a real samurai experience program supervised based on his overwhelming technique. The instruction is safe and careful by a master of Shushin-ryu Iaijutsu Heiho, whose head is Isao Machii, so even beginners can participate with confidence. This experience focuses on the structure of the sword and its original use, and is the only one in the world where you can learn real samurai techniques. By holding a real Japanese sword in your hands, you can feel the history and weight of the sword and learn how the samurai of old lived and fought. After wearing a kimono, learning the samurai etiquette, and mastering the basic sword techniques of the Japanese sword, you will practice Iai and swordsmanship. This experience, which allows you to learn the spirit of Bushido and traditional Japanese culture in depth, will bring you one step closer to becoming a real samurai.

A portion of the Tada Shrine grounds can be rented exclusively for you!
A blissful moment at Tada Shrine, the birthplace of the Genji clan. A sacred space dedicated to Minamoto no Mitsunaka, completely reserved for your use! A special portion of the historic Tada Shrine grounds can be reserved for your use, allowing you to enjoy a quiet and solemn atmosphere without worrying about the eyes of other worshippers. This shrine, dotted with buildings designated as Important Cultural Properties and dedicated to Minamoto no Mitsunaka, is a special place for you to spend a luxurious time. While freely strolling the grounds of the shrine wearing a special sword, you can experience the samurai etiquette and history at a place where ancient samurai prayed for victory in battle, and experience a true samurai experience with your body and mind. This experience will allow you to feel the history firsthand and leave you with a deep impression that you cannot get from just sightseeing.

fields.title: 2025 Saitama Prefecture Famous Sword Exhibition "Bizen-den Sword Lecture"
fields.fee_details: University and high school students: 100 yen, junior high school students and younger: free
fields.description:
The Bizen-den Sword Lecture, held at Kawagoe City Museum in late October to November 2025, offers a rare opportunity to explore Japan’s legendary Bizen sword tradition. Renowned for their elegant hamon (temper patterns) and resilient jigane (steel texture), Bizen blades, such as those by Suishinshi Masahide and Taikei Naotane, embody the pinnacle of samurai craftsmanship. 

Expert commentators from the Japanese Sword Preservation Society will guide attendees through the blades’ historical significance, forging techniques, and aesthetic beauty. This 200-yen event is perfect for both novices and enthusiasts, bridging ancient martial culture with modern appreciation. Don’t miss this chance to witness the enduring spirit of the samurai through the timeless art of the sword.

fields.title: [Osaka, Honmachi] Authentic tea ceremony class by a tea master who taught at a famous temple
fields.description:
Recommended for customers who want to learn authentic tea ceremony You can learn authentic tea ceremony from a tea ceremony master who has a very difficult qualification. The tea ceremony master in charge was the person in charge of famous temple tea ceremonies. This is a popular class that many customers from Japan and abroad visit in search of this tea ceremony master. We receive many reservations from customers every month. 

The class is famous and has 6 classrooms in Osaka and Kyoto. Currently, we teach Japanese culture in classrooms, schools, companies, hotels, community activities, etc. World-famous 5-star hotels and companies have highly praised us as an authentic cultural class. Achievements 5-star class with over 1,000 reviews on other activity sites, and many awards. The classroom facility is an authentic tea room. It is not just a room. An additional tea room usage fee of 1,000 to 2,000 yen is required. For the Kyoto classroom, if there are multiple participants, it is 1,000 yen per person. For the Kyoto classroom and Honmachi classroom, if the total number of participants at the time of the experience is only 1 person, an additional fee of 2,000 yen will be charged. 

There is also a special tea room that can only be used at our classroom. This price is only possible at our classroom. In recent years, prices have been rising around the world, but the prices at our classes in Japan have remained the same for a long time. About the "Tea Ceremony Experience" (1) You can only learn this here (2) The location of the experience may not be available on the reserved date due to facility circumstances. In that case, you will be guided to a nearby classroom near Osaka Castle or Shitennoji. If the location is changed, we will confirm with the customer and make the necessary arrangements. Even if the location is changed, there are other classrooms nearby, so it will not be considered a cancellation by the organizer. 

Nearby classrooms Osaka Castle classrooms Within walking distance of the JR Kyobashi Station South Exit or Osaka Business Park Subway Station Shitennoji classrooms Within walking distance of Shitennoji-mae Yuhigaoka Subway Station

tea ceremony
There are things that can only be learned here.

experience and practice
In the classroom, experience and practice can learn the same thing.

fields.title: Meiji Shrine "Japanese Sword Craftsmanship Exhibition" October 25th (Sat) - November 16th (Sun)
fields.description:
The Meiji Restoration marked the end of the samurai era, placing Japanese swords in jeopardy. Amid such upheaval, it is an undeniable fact that Japanese sword culture has been passed down to the present day thanks to the efforts of Emperor Meiji, who valued the preservation of the history and traditions of Japanese swords and the passing on of sword techniques.

With the advent of the Reiwa era, the value of Japanese swords is widely recognized both at home and abroad, and they are highly acclaimed as works of art.

In the fall of 2022, to commemorate the 100th anniversary of Emperor Meiji's death and the 170th anniversary of his birth, our association honored the Emperor Meiji's achievements, who had a profound impact on the revival of Japanese sword culture, by forging a sword at the Meiji Jingu Treasure House on November 3rd, a day closely associated with the enshrined deity. Furthermore, we held a "Japanese Sword Craftsmanship Exhibition" for 21 days, including the annual festival day, showcasing the connection between Emperor Meiji and Japanese sword culture, providing a valuable opportunity to convey its appeal to many people.

Now, after three years, we are once again holding the "Japanese Sword Mastery Exhibition," which brings together masterpieces, mainly works by contemporary swordsmiths.
